channel.title: Comments on: Ammado wins ISA new company of the year award

item.title: By: Segala
item.dc:creator: Segala
item.description:
<strong>A URL is enough to win best company of the year...</strong>
The Irish Software Association (ISA) recently awarded a company called Ammando ‘best company of the year’ award. I had to read the post on Blognation about 5 times for it to sink in. The company hasn’t launched yet! According to Blog...
item.content:encoded:
A URL is enough to win best company of the year…

The Irish Software Association (ISA) recently awarded a company called Ammando ‘best company of the year’ award. I had to read the post on Blognation about 5 times for it to sink in. The company hasn’t launched yet! According to Blog…

item.title: By: blognation Ireland » Blog Archive » Interesting winners at Irish Software Association Awards
item.dc:creator: blognation Ireland » Blog Archive » Interesting winners at Irish Software Association Awards
item.description: [...] New company of the year was Ammado. This is a semi-stealth social networking start-up co-founded by serial entrepreneur Peter Conlon. Its focus is on connecting charities and non-profits to people. I’ve seen the private-beta in action and I expect the full launch to get a lot of attention. Obviously the ISA guys got a good look at it too. [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] New company of the year was Ammado. This is a semi-stealth social networking start-up co-founded by serial entrepreneur Peter Conlon. Its focus is on connecting charities and non-profits to people. I’ve seen the private-beta in action and I expect the full launch to get a lot of attention. Obviously the ISA guys got a good look at it too. [...]
